data.snapshot: Ethereum plunged ~15% from $4,590 to $3,896, briefly probing $3,846. Momentum is bearish (RSI ~34.7) with short SMA under mid SMA and a sweep suggesting a stophunt.
chronology: High at $4,610.46 early in the window.
Low printed $3,846.41, a ~7.38% intramove from the peak.
No volume spike accompanying the drop (volumeSpike=false).
technicalReadout: RSI 34.7 — near oversold but not deeply oversold.
SMA8 ($3,916.60) is below SMA21 ($3,978.07): short-term bearish bias.
Lower highs indicate failing bullish follow-through.
Sweep flag true — probable liquidity grab beneath prior lows.
No volume spike to confirm strong capitulation; move may lack conviction.

scenarios.title: Bear continuation
scenarios.text: Failure to reclaim SMA21 and continued lower highs lead to further downside toward prior support zones below $3,800; momentum stays negative if RSI remains under 40.

scenarios.title: Short-term rebound
scenarios.text: After the sweep and absent heavy volume, price could bounce back to test SMA21 (~$3,978) and recent highs near $4,200 if buyers step in at the $3,800-$3,900 area.

scenarios.title: Range-bound / choppy action
scenarios.text: If volume stays muted, expect consolidation between $3,800–$4,200 with volatility spikes on liquidity hunts before a clear trend resumes.

checklist: For demand zone longs: wait for a bullish reaction candle + above‑average buy volume; stop under sweep low.
For structured shorts: wait for a retest of resistance that fails and shows rejection volume; reduce size into expiries.
If price closes daily above key resistance with volume, reconsider bearish sizing.
Keep position sizing modest — the structure is still corrective and volatile.
